data.enText: any of the physical or mental abilities that a person is born with

data.chText: 她直到临终那天一直保持着思维和理解能力。
data.enText: She retained her mental faculties (= the ability to think and understand) until the day she died.

data.chText: 拥有一切官能（能够说、听、看见、理解等）
data.enText: to be in full possession of your faculties (= be able to speak, hear, see, understand, etc.)
a particular ability for doing sth
the faculty of understanding complex issues

data.chText: 他具有看到自己错误的能力。
data.enText: He had a faculty for seeing his own mistakes.
a department or group of related departments in a college or university

data.chText: （高等院校中院、系的）全体教师

data.hoverText: 可与单数或复数动词连用的可数名词

data.enText: all the teachers in a faculty of a college or university
all the teachers of a particular university or college

ex.chText: 他有惊人的心算能力。
ex.enText: He has an amazing facility for mental arithmetic.

ex.chText: 她拉小提琴的天赋令人惊讶。
ex.enText: She plays the violin with surprising facility.

synonyms.bx: 指与生俱来的学习或做某事的能力。

ex.chText: 她适应新环境的能力很强。
ex.enText: She has a great faculty for adapting new environments.

ex.chText: 他有处理棘手问题的能力。
ex.enText: He had the faculty of dealing with tough problems.

ex.chText: 她有潜力成为一名口译工作者。
ex.enText: She has the potential to become an interpreter.

ex.chText: 他是一名很有潜力的年轻歌手。
ex.enText: He is a young singer with great potential.

synonyms.bx: 指虽已具备但尚未发挥出来的能力。

ex.chText: 父亲发现儿子有音乐天赋。
ex.enText: The father found that his son had a musical talent.

ex.chText: 你有绘画天分吗?
ex.enText: Do you have a talent for painting?

ex.chText: 他是位文采出众的作家。
ex.enText: He is a writer of exceptional literary talent.

synonyms.bx: 指人在某一方面所具有的可发展和培养的突出天赋，语气弱于 genius。

ex.chText: 他有写作的天赋。
ex.enText: He has a natural aptitude for writing.

ex.chText: 爱迪生具有发明创造的非凡才能。
ex.enText: Edison had a remarkable aptitude for inventing new things.

ex.chText: 那个小男孩因在数学方面极具天赋而从二年级跳到了四年级。
ex.enText: The boy skipped the third grade because of his great aptitude in mathematics.

ex.chText: 在孩提时代，他便显露出弹奏钢琴的天赋。
ex.enText: As a child, he showed an aptitude for the piano.

synonyms.bx: 指天生的才能，尤指在学习方面的聪颖资质，能迅速掌握某种技能、技巧等，通常后接介词 for。

ex.chText: 乔治具有激发他人信心的能力。
ex.enText: George has a faculty for inspiring confidence in people.

ex.chText: 学习的确增强了她的判断能力。
ex.enText: Studying has really sharpened her critical faculties.

synonyms.bx: 指某种特殊的才能、能力。

ex.chText: 爱因斯坦是个伟大的科学天才。
ex.enText: Einstein was a great scientific genius.

ex.chText: 他在科学和艺术两方面都是天才。
ex.enText: He was a genius in both science and art.

ex.chText: 他有几分父亲传给他的天赋。
ex.enText: He has some share of his father's genius.

ex.chText: 她具有学习语言学的天赋。
ex.enText: She has a genius for linguistics.

synonyms.bx: 语气最强，可指天赋极高者，也可指天赋的特殊才能与智力，强调高智商，含具有独特的创造力之意。

ex.chText: 我一向有学习语言的天分。
ex.enText: I've always had a gift for learning languages.

ex.chText: 他似乎有模仿他人作品的天赋。
ex.enText: He seemed to have a gift for pastiche.

synonyms.bx: 指人天生具有的能力或品质，但不一定具有创造力；也可泛指某人在某一方面突出的个人才能。

ex.chText: 记人的本领
ex.enText: a knack for remembering faces

ex.chText: 他天生有赚钱的本领。
ex.enText: He has a knack for making money.

ex.chText: 蒂尔有说俏皮话的本事。
ex.enText: Till has a knack of saying funny things.

ex.chText: 她有让人倾听的本领。
ex.enText: She's got the knack of getting people to listen.

synonyms.bx: 指人天生的或后天学来的某种技能或本领。

tr: one of the inherent cognitive or perceptual powers of the mind
the body of teachers and administrators at a school
example: the dean addressed the letter to the entire staff of the university

value.def: Your faculties are your physical and mental abilities.

example.ex: He was drunk and not in control of his faculties...
example.tran: 他喝醉了，浑身都不听使唤了。

example.ex: It is also a myth that the faculty of hearing is greatly increased in blind people.
example.tran: 盲人的听力会大幅增强也是一种谬谈。

gramarinfo.label: usu pl, oft poss N, N <l>of</l> n

value.def: A faculty is a group of related departments in some universities, or the people who work in them.

example.ex: ...the Faculty of Social and Political Sciences.

value.tran: (大学的)院系;(大学院系的)教职工

value.def: A faculty is all the teaching staff of a university or college, or of one department.

example.ex: The faculty agreed on a change in the requirements...
example.tran: 全体教师一致同意修改规定。

example.ex: How can faculty improve their teaching so as to encourage creativity?
example.tran: 教师们如何才能改进教学以激发创造性呢？
声名显赫的斯坦福大学的教师们

value.tran: (大学、学院或院系的)全体教员

trans: 教师；系教员；教员；大学教学人员；教职人员
教职员工；教职工；教職員；教职员
艺术学院；文学院；文學院；人文学院；文科系
教授会；教授会议；全体教师会议；教师会议；教授会, 教员会议
理学院；自然科学学院；自然科学系；科学系
能力；心智官能；智力；心理官能；心理机能
职员之一；（院校）系里的成员
